definition: to astonish people (with a miraculous feat)
to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm
man/person/people/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4]
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it
to lift/to hold up/to cite/to enumerate/to act/to raise/to choose/to elect/act/move/deed
variant of 舉|举[ju3]

sentences.english: You don’t get to 600 million friends without doing something spectacular.
sentences.chinese: 要没有什么惊人之举，你是得不到6亿好友的。

sentences.english: He is a man who always does something that astonishes others.
sentences.chinese: 他是个常会做出惊人之举的人。

sentences.english: Eg He is a man who always does something that astonishes others.
sentences.chinese: 他是个常会做出惊人之举的人。

sentences.english: No one had prior knowledge of her stunt on the stage.
sentences.chinese: 没有人事先知道她在舞台上有那样的惊人之举。

sentences.english: So, God had done something terrific.
sentences.chinese: 上帝成就了件惊人之举。

definition: to exceed all expectations/to come as a surprise
to overstep the bounds of what is proper/to take sth too far/(of a measuring device) to go off the scale
turned out other than expected (idiom); unexpected
unexpected (idiom)/surprising
universally shocking/to offend the whole of society
folly
quick witted/able to think fast in an emergency
unusual/abnormal
daring/presumptuous/daredevil
see 冒大不韙|冒大不韪[mao4 da4 bu4 wei3]
pinyin: mao4 tian1 xia4 zhi1 da4 bu4 wei3

definition: disturbance/incident
to offend
lit. deep plans and distant thoughts/to plan far ahead (idiom)
to rebel against orthodoxy/to depart from established practices
dirty trick
complete change from the normal state (idiom); quite uncharacteristic/entirely outside the norm/out of character
